interlinear-text.item: Recorded by Husniya Khujamyorova in Vinukt, Tajikistan, June, 2016.

phrase.item: A bandit gives a hard time to a lady, she escapes from him and goes to a city and becomes a king.
She becomes king, then these bandits come (to the local king) and say, Oh king, it was like this.
"What kind of lady was she, my dear, she held an arrow?"
The part about the arrow is unclear. The verb is left out (tʃiz kərti)
He says, "Well, you all should look for her, there is no point in asking me!"
"What kind of lady was she that she lied to you?" "How come all seven of you were not able to handle that lady?"
Seven against one, she is a fairy.
Then the king comes and and says, "This is what happened, the lady imposed on me a condition."
"One of my apricot (trees) caught something and the lady got away."
The use of di here is unclear. Why the bare stem? Cf. Tajik zadam gum kardam 'I lost it.'
(The bandit) says, "Hmm, are you the king and you couldn't protect the woman?" "The lady ran away from your palace."
"You are a nothing king, you are a brainless king".
Then the man comes the third time and he also didn't recognize her and says, "Well, I am your wife, I became a king here."
"Now, you here, governing and winning is my part, (but) you are the king."
"Governing and winning is my part, (but) you are the king," she says to her husband.
Whenever you do bad things, the result is never good.
The old woman who did bad things, will never reach her goals.
The fairy lady became a king in another city.
They took her as a king.
